meanings.definition: Additional items or elements beyond what is necessary or expected.
meanings.sent1: She always carries extras of pencils in her bag.
meanings.sent2: The party planner brought extras of balloons for decoration.
meanings.sent3: He packed extras of snacks for the road trip.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was like having extras of sunshine on a cloudy day.
meanings.sent5: The extras of laughter made the gathering even more joyful.

meanings.definition: Actors or performers in a film or play who have minor roles.
meanings.sent1: The movie director needed extras for the crowd scene.
meanings.sent2: She enjoyed being one of the extras in the school play.
meanings.sent3: The extras in the background accidentally photobombed the main scene.
meanings.sent4: His life felt like being one of the extras in someone else's story.
meanings.sent5: The extras added depth to the movie's setting.

meanings.definition: Supplementary or optional features or services.
meanings.sent1: The hotel offers extras like spa treatments for guests.
meanings.sent2: The car dealership includes extras such as a navigation system.
meanings.sent3: She decided to splurge on extras like a deluxe upgrade.
meanings.sent4: The extras on the phone plan were not worth the additional cost.
meanings.sent5: The extras on the vacation package made it a luxurious experience.
